name: Good Mornings
steps: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
Engage your core muscles and keep your back straight.
Slowly bend forward from your hips, pushing your glutes back as if you are trying to touch the wall behind you with your hips.
Keep your knees slightly bent and your weight on your heels.
Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position by contracting your glutes and hamstrings.

prenatal: Although they are safe to perform while pregnant, you may want to opt for adding a lighter weight, or no weight at all!.
As the baby grows, and therefore your bump, you'll need to take a slightly wider stance to allow for added space.

comments: Don't round your lower back, as this can lead to injury.
Keep your neck in a neutral position and avoid looking up or down.
Use a light weight or no weight at all until you feel comfortable with the movement.
Gradually increase the weight as you become more confident and stronger.
If you experience any pain or discomfort, stop the exercise and consult a fitness professional.
